FromOurTeam.body:
Dear Customer,

My name is Rep Name and I am with TAC Entitlement team and the current owner of your case, Case#

From the note details on your case, it appears you are not seeking technical support or hardware replacement in this instance. Instead, it looks like this is related to an eDelivery order issue. If so, please be advised that we in the Technical Assistance Center have no power to fulfill or support eDelivery issues.

For eDelivery issues you will need to seek support within the eDelivery application website itself: https://edelivery.cisco.com/esd/ or you may contact eDelivery team by sending an email to: edelivery-customer-support@cisco.com. You can also find FAQs here: https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en_us/partners/downloads/765/tools/edelivery/FAQ.pdf.

Since we are unable to assist with e-Delivery issue and as this is not a technical issue, I will be closing the case by end of next business day. I apologize for the inconvenience.

Regards,
Rep Name
Global Service Relations Global Customer Experience Centers
.:|:.:|:.:|:.

Dear Customer,

My name is Rep Name and I am with TAC Entitlement team and the current owner of your case, Case#

After reading the case notes included in the service request, I understand that you need assistance downloading a bootable file.
Kindly informed OVA files, Communications CD/DVD Software, or Bootable images requests can be requested via MCE and only available from the commercial site. Cisco Technical Support nor Entitlement enterprise team does not provide service for this type of request.
For End Customers Product Upgrade Tool will be redirected starting from May 16, 2020. to the MCE, where they can continue to perform software version upgrades through 'Version Upgrade'.

More info and steps could be shared over: https://www.cisco.com/c/dam/en/us/td/docs/entitlement_asset_mgmt/docs/MCE_User_Guide_Version_Upgrade.pdf
Scenario 1: If you have a software service contract, directly with Cisco covering your software product, you may be able to order a copy of the software OVA files or CD by using My Cisco Entitlement (MCE) Tool located at: https://mce.cisco.com/mce/#/login/portal

In order to use My Cisco Entitlement Tool, you must first have a Cisco.com ID that is linked to your software contract.

Scenario 2: If the MCE Tool doesn't display this information, you will need to open a ticket with the MCE Support team for assistance. To open a case with MCE Support team, please follow the below steps: Access MCE support using Support Case Manager. Please click Open a New Case, pull-down to select Software Licensing, and choose My Cisco Entitlements (MCE) for the category.

Since PUT or MCE issues are not handled by TAC, we will proceed to close this case. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Regards,
Rep Name
Global Service Relations
Global Customer Experience Centers

FromOurTeam.scenario: Software Download issues || Contract was not associated
FromOurTeam.body:
Dear Customer,

My name is Rep Name and I am with TAC Entitlement team and the current owner of your case, Case#

I apologize for the inconvenience. I understand that you are getting an error downloading the software from the website. I checked the SN Serial Number (PID) and it shows covered under contract Contract Number for TAC support, major and minor upgrades.

The contract was not associated to the CCO profile (Customer CCOID) so that could be the reason why you were getting that error, now it has been associated, so It should allow you to download the software now.

Please clear the cache and cookies in your browser(s), log out of Cisco.com and back in to Cisco.com, and update your browsers. Try different browsers and see if you are able to download.

If you keep having trouble downloading the Software please provide me with the following:

* User ID (Cisco.com ID used to download software)
* Desired Software Release or File Name
* Software Download URL
* Please include a screen shot of page/ error

Once I received this information, I will escalate the issue to our Software Download team so they can investigate your profile to determine what error is causing this problem and permanently correct it to allow downloads.

Please let me know if you were able to download the software at this time.


Regards,
Rep Name
Global Service Relations
Global Customer Experience Centers

Dear Customer,

My name is Rep Name and I am with the TAC Entitlement Team/Service Relations. I have taken ownership of your case Case#

The reason your service request has come to the entitlement team is because you are using an invalid CCO for TAC support.

In order to open a Service Request for technical support or replacement, you need a CCO ID.

A 'CCO ID' is an acronym for 'Cisco Connection Online IDentification.' and remains the name of the login identifier used to access all Cisco on-line services.

Cisco.com account enables you to access enhanced content, training, technical support, and product information and it takes just a few minutes to complete.

You can register for an account by accessing the Cisco Registration Tool using the process below:

Creating a CCOID

1. Go to Cisco.com
2. Click the 'Account' link on the upper right side of the corner of the screen
3. Click on the 'Register Now' button and complete the required business information.
4. Create login name and password
5. Select two secret questions and provide answers
6. Under 'Fine Print', Select 'yes' for Cisco Privacy Statement.
7. Select Yes/No for communication preferences.
8. Click 'Submit'. You should then see, the 'Thank you for registering' page noting you will receive an email to complete registration
9. To complete registration, check your inbox for an email message from Cisco, and follow the link in the message to confirm your information.

Please be aware that, you must have: a valid physical address, a phone number and email address saved in your Cisco Account.

Since a new case will have to be created using the valid CCO ID, we will proceed to close this case. We apologize for the inconvenience.

Thank you for your understanding and cooperation.


Regards,
Rep Name
Global Service Relations
Global Customer Experience Centers

.:|:.:|:.:|:.

Dear Customer,

Please be advised that to get technical assistance from Cisco TAC, your product must be covered under an active service contract or warranty that provides access to TAC support.

We have reviewed the serial number you provided (Serial Number) and have determined that the product you are trying to get support for (PID) is not covered under an active service contract or warranty for TAC support. So now per cisco policies we will be forced to close this case as not entitled.

Cisco is enforcing technical support based on active contracts covered in profiles and will only allow you technical support for the active products covered in the contracts that are associated with your profile or that are under warranty. In order to entitle this case for technical support, the product needs to be covered an active service contract. Please contact your point of sales for further information on how to obtain a service contract.

Be advised that a new case can be opened using the serial number or contract number that is being worked on once the contract is placed on it or you can request it to be re-opened within the first 14 days of its closure once the entitlement situation is solved. After this time a new case will need to be opened.

Cisco apologizes for any inconvenience that this may cause. Thank you for your understanding and cooperation in helping us insure that the Cisco Support policies are followed correctly.

Note: In the meantime, you can check the Community Support forums for help.

For community based support, visit the Cisco Support Community at: https://community.cisco.com/t5/technology-and-support/ct-p/technology-support. Please post a new discussion to the Support Community. An expert will review and respond to your question, usually within one business day.


Regards,
Rep Name
Global Service Relations
Global Customer Experience Centers

Dear Customer,

My name is Rep Name and I am with the TAC Entitlement Team/Service Relations. I have taken ownership of your case Case#

You indicated that you purchased used equipment from a source other than Cisco or an Authorized Cisco Reseller.

In order to get support from Cisco on this product, you will need to complete two steps to certify that the product is licensed and in working order -

1) Contact Cisco Customer Service or a Cisco Authorized Partner / Reseller to purchase a software license agreement. Once you purchase the agreement, make sure that you have the agreement information available when you are ready to purchase a support contract.

2) Contact Cisco Customer Service to arrange a product inspection. Product inspection is handled by Cisco On-Site Services and verifies whether your equipment is in working order and supportable. After the inspection, you will receive results of the inspection indicating if the product is supportable. Note that the inspection is not a guarantee that the product will be certified as supportable. If your product is certified, you then provide these documented results to either Cisco Service Sales or a Cisco Authorized Reseller who sells Cisco support services.

Once these steps are complete, depending upon your location you may purchase a service contract for your product from a Cisco Partner or Reseller or directly from Cisco.

To contact Cisco Customer Service regarding software licenses and product inspections, please see Customer Service Contacts located at: http://www.cisco.com/web/ordering/cs_info/or3/o31/ordering_transactional_customer_service_contacts.html

As we cannot move further without the steps mentioned above being completed we must proceed with the case closure.


Regards,
Rep Name
Global Service Relations
Global Customer Experience Centers

notes.scenario: Validate Bypass with a Cisco Employee via webex chat
notes.body:
I need you to confirm me the following to validate the bypass:

- Your or a Cisco Employee will remain as the Point of contact on this case, and this Point of Contact will handle all communications between the end Customer and the TAC Engineer. As customer cannot work directly with the engineer.
- You cannot say (as an example) 'Please contact John at American Airlines to continue troubleshooting without me', as this Point of Contact must be actively working on this case form start to finish.
If you can validate me these I can validate the bypass and forward it to TAC.

notes.scenario: Not related GSR case send from Licensing
notes.body: Entitlement team only manages entitlement issues to receive TAC support or to download Software from the Software Central, as stated on task https://wwwin.cisco.com/c/cec/organizations/cisco-services/ts/tso/gtc/cin/agent/glo/gsr-entitlement-logistics.html 'GSR: for SW download and TAC support entitlement questions.' this request is not under either, redirect customer properly, do not route over to entitlement when there is no entitlement/technical issue, we're the TAC Entitlement team not the Sales department and therefore we cannot assist with contract/product acquisition questions.

EOL device is covered under extended support contract, support must be provided since the contract overrides the EOL status
'End-of-Support / Last Day of Support (LDoS) date for most hardware products is normally five years after the end-of-sale date. Once a product passes its LDoS date, it is no longer officially supported by the TAC. Contracts may not be sold on this product, Logistics does not spare replacements for RMAs, and Service Relations may not sell T&M TAC support or RMA replacements. If a product comes up as LDoS but it still covered (active) under a valid contract, the TAC will support the product; however software upgrades are likely not being supported. This is common for products under contracts sold through Migration Support Services.'
